date

Interface DateInterface

    DateTimeInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OOSCDate, OOSCDateTime

      • timeBetween

        int timeBetween(int type,
                DateInterface date1)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        OCL: timeBetween(int type, DateInterface date1) Assume that the type is correct (1, 2 or 3)
        Parameters:
        type - 1: Compute the difference in year, 2: Compute the difference in months, 3: Compute the difference in years
        date1 - The date you want to compute the difference with.
        Returns:
        the number of day, month or year between this and date1. Respectively same result as daysBetween(this, date1), monthBetween(this, date1), yearBetween(this, date1)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        void synchWithUTCTimeserver()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        OCL: Assume nothing: immutable
        Throws:
        Exception: - if no connection: IOException if no access to the data: NullPointerException if the format is not correct: IllegalArgumentException if the parsing get wrong: NumberFormatException
        java.lang.Exception

      • toNumberOfDays

        OCL: Assume nothing: immutable
        Returns:
        the number of day till 1 January 0000

      • toNumberOfMonths

        int toNumberOfMonths()
        OCL: Assume nothing: immutable Transform the current date (this) in the number of month till 1 January 0000. Example: toNumberOfMonths 1 January 0000 -> 1 toNumberOfMonths 31 January 0000 -> 1
        Returns:
        the number of month till 1 January 0000

      • toDateInterface

        static DateInterface toDateInterface(int numberOfDays)
        OCL: toDateInterface(int numberOfDays) Assume the numberOfDays is positive
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the corresponding DateInterface

      • daysBetween

        static int daysBetween(DateInterface date1,
                       DateInterface date2)
        OCL: Assume nothing: immutable
        Parameters:
        date1 - The first date
        date2 - The second date
        Returns:
        the number of day between two dates. If date1 is greater than date2, then the result will be positive. If the two days are identical, the result will be 0, and if date1 is smaller than date2, then the result will be negative.

      • monthBetween

        static int monthBetween(DateInterface date1,
                        DateInterface date2)
        OCL: Assume nothing: immutable
        Parameters:
        date1 - The first date
        date2 - The second date
        Returns:
        the number of month between two dates. If date1 is greater than date2, then the result will be positive. If the two days have the same month and the same year, the result will be 0, and if date1 is smaller than date2, then the result will be negative. Note that days have no importance in this computation. Example: monthBetween 28 January 2000 and 4 January 2000 -> 0

      • yearBetween

        static int yearBetween(DateInterface date1,
                       DateInterface date2)
        OCL: Assume nothing: immutable
        Parameters:
        date1 - The first date
        date2 - The second date
        Returns:
        the number of year between two dates. If date1's year is greater than date2's year, then the result will be positive. If the two days have the same month and the same year, the result will be 0, and if date1's year is smaller than date2's year, then the result will be negative. Note that days and months have no importance in this computation. Example: yearBetween 28 January 2000 and 4 June 2000 -> 0

      • isLeapYear

        static java.lang.Boolean isLeapYear(int year)
        OCL: isLeapYear(int year) assume that the year is positive or null
        Parameters:
        year - the year (positive or null)
        Returns:
        True if the year is leap, false otherwise

        static int numberOfDaysInYear(int year)
        OCL: isLeapYear(int year) assume that the year is positive or null
        Parameters:
        year - the year (positive or null)
        Returns:
        the number of days in this year
